text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Peel and dice the potatoes into equal-sized pieces.
Add the potatoes to the boiling water and cook until they are tender, about 15-20 minutes.
While the potatoes are cooking, chop the bacon into small pieces and cook in a skillet over medium heat until crispy.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Add 2 tablespoons of butter, milk, salt, and pepper; mash until smooth and creamy.
In the same skillet used to cook the bacon, sauté the chopped cabbage with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter until it's soft and tender.
Mix the sautéed cabbage and crumbled bacon into the mashed potatoes. Stir everything together until well combined.
Serve hot, garnished with additional butter if desired.
